federal_pmc_nodes.recommendation_name: Federal Oversight & Child and Family Services Reviews (CFSR)
federal_pmc_nodes.summary_html: Federal **Child and Family Services Reviews (CFSR)** monitor state performance on safety, permanency, and well-being. Project Milk Carton flags states that repeatedly fail or never publish CFSR improvement plans.
federal_pmc_nodes.authority_html:
- **45 CFR Part 1355** ‚Äî CFSR procedures and performance metrics  
- **Social Security Act IV-E (42 U.S.C. ¬ß¬ß 670‚Äì679c)** ‚Äî ties funding to CFSR compliance
federal_pmc_nodes.recommendation_basis: Audit state compliance reports; identify chronic non-performance; trigger citizen review panels to demand enforcement.
source_reference: CFSR oversight and IV-E compliance links

federal_pmc_nodes.recommendation_name: Office of Inspector General (OIG) & Single Audit Act Accountability
federal_pmc_nodes.summary_html: Federal **OIG** investigations and **Single Audit Act** reviews track misuse of child-welfare funds. Project Milk Carton aggregates audit findings and highlights unresolved repeat deficiencies.
federal_pmc_nodes.authority_html:
- **Inspector General Act (5 U.S.C. App.)** ‚Äî OIG oversight of HHS  
- **Single Audit Act (31 U.S.C. ¬ß¬ß 7501‚Äì7507)** ‚Äî audits of federally funded programs
federal_pmc_nodes.recommendation_basis: Compare OIG and audit findings to CFSR results to locate financial mismanagement and push for state public disclosure.
source_reference: OIG and Single Audit Act oversight refs

federal_pmc_nodes.summary_html: **CAPTA ¬ß5106a(c)** requires every state to maintain **Citizen Review Panels** that evaluate CPS policies. Project Milk Carton checks whether panels are active, independent, and publicly reporting.
federal_pmc_nodes.authority_html: - **CAPTA (42 U.S.C. ¬ß 5106a(c))** ‚Äî Citizen Review Panel mandate and reporting requirements
federal_pmc_nodes.recommendation_basis: Verify panel existence and publication of annual reports; mobilize community participation where panels are inactive.

federal_pmc_nodes.recommendation_name: Protect Our Kids Act ‚Äì Federal Commission Reports
federal_pmc_nodes.summary_html: The **Protect Our Kids Act (PL 112-275)** created a national commission to study child-fatality prevention. Project Milk Carton cross-references its findings with state fatality data to expose non-implementation.
federal_pmc_nodes.authority_html: - **Public Law 112-275 (Protect Our Kids Act)** ‚Äî national commission and reporting framework
federal_pmc_nodes.recommendation_basis: Analyze federal commission recommendations versus state policy adoption; publicize gaps in implementation.

federal_pmc_nodes.summary_html: Federal transparency statutes‚Äî**FOIA** and **Sunshine Act**‚Äîrequire disclosure of government data. Project Milk Carton promotes FOIA requests and public dashboards for child-welfare records.

- **Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. ¬ß 552)** ‚Äî public access to records  
- **Government in the Sunshine Act (5 U.S.C. ¬ß 552b)** ‚Äî open-meeting requirements

federal_pmc_nodes.recommendation_name: Project Milk Carton AI Analytic Layer
federal_pmc_nodes.summary_html: The **Project Milk Carton AI Layer** performs cross-analysis of federal and state chains to identify weak points, policy gaps, and non-compliance. This is the citizen feedback mechanism for accountability and reform.
federal_pmc_nodes.authority_html: No direct statutory authority ‚Äî citizen innovation layer built on public data and federal transparency laws.
federal_pmc_nodes.recommendation_basis: Use federal and state schemas to map decision failures, quantify due-process gaps, and generate recommendations for citizen-driven reform.
source_reference: Project Milk Carton AI initiative documentation.
